  <td width="57%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">207</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">172</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="427" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="76" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="76" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="83" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:25.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increase in
Interest expense was primarily due to higher effective interest rates in the
third quarter and first nine months of 2006, compared with the same periods of
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:25.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense
is presented as part of Cost of Global Financing in the Consolidated Statement
of Earnings only if the related external borrowings are to support the Global
Financing external business.&#160; See page 70
for additional information regarding Global Financing debt and interest expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retirement-Related
Benefits</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:25.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table provides the total pre-tax cost for all retirement-related plans.&#160; Cost amounts are included as an addition to
the company&#146;s cost and expense amounts in the Consolidated Statement of
Earnings within the caption (e.g., Cost, SG&amp;A, RD&amp;E) relating to the
job function of the individuals participating in the plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 7.2pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-7.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="57%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.16%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in the
amounts above, the company had costs of approximately $311 million and&#160; $262 million associated with its defined
benefit pension plans for the third quarter of 2006 and 2005, respectively. The
comparable amount for the first nine months of 2006 and 2005 was costs of
approximately $985 million and $851 million, respectively.&#160; These increases were primarily driven by the
recognition of previously deferred actuarial losses in accordance with SFAS 87,
&#147;Employers&#146; Accounting for Pensions&#148;.&#160;
The third quarter 2006 year-to-year increase impacted gross profit by
approximately $55 million, RD&amp;E expense by approximately $7 million and
SG&amp;A expense by approximately $9 million. The nine months of 2006
year-to-year increase impacted gross profit&#160;
by approximately $181 million and RD&amp;E expense by approximately $24
million, while SG&amp;A expense decreased by approximately $12 million and
Other (income) and expense declined by approximately $14 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquired Intangible Asset
Amortization</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
company has been investing in targeted acquisitions primarily within the
Software and Global Services segments to increase its capabilities in higher
value market segments.&#160; As disclosed on
page 19, the number and the size of these acquisitions will increase in future
periods resulting in an increase in the amount of amortization of the acquired
intangible assets.&#160; The following table
presents the total acquired intangible asset amortization included in the
Consolidated Statement of Earnings:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">95</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">281</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provision for Income
Taxes</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The effective tax
rates for the third quarter of 2006 and 2005 were 30.0 percent and 48.0
percent, respectively. The corresponding effective tax rates for the first nine
months of 2006 and 2005 were 30.0 percent and 37.7 percent, respectively. The
decreases in the quarterly and nine months&#146; tax rates were primarily
attributable to the absence of the foreign earnings repatriation-related tax
charge recorded in the third quarter of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With limited
exception, the company is no longer subject to U.S. federal, state and local or
non-U.S. income tax audits by taxing authorities for years before 1999.&#160; The years subsequent to 1998 contain matters
that could be subject to differing interpretations of applicable tax laws and
regulations as it relates to the amount and/or timing of income, deductions and
tax credits.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">44</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although the outcome of
tax audits is always uncertain, the company believes that adequate amounts of
tax and interest have been provided for any adjustments that are expected to
result for these years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Internal
Revenue Service (IRS) commenced its audit of the company&#146;s U.S. tax returns for
2001 through 2003 in the first quarter of 2005. The company is in preliminary
discussions with the IRS regarding the tax treatment of certain items, however,
no adjustments on these issues have been formally proposed by the IRS as of
September 30, 2006.&#160; The company
anticipates that this audit will be substantially completed by the end of 2006.
While it is not yet possible to determine the impact of this audit on income
tax expense, the company does not anticipate having to make a significant cash
tax payment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Earnings
Per Share</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic earnings per
share is computed on the basis of the weighted-average number of shares of
common stock outstanding during the period.&#160;
Diluted earnings per share is computed on the basis of the weighted
average number of common stock plus the effect of dilutive potential common
shares outstanding during the period using the treasury stock method.&#160; Dilutive potential common shares include
outstanding stock options, stock awards and convertible notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.58%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Actual shares
outstanding at September 30, 2006 was 1,506.4 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted
average number of common shares outstanding assuming dilution during the third
quarter and first nine months of 2006 was 82.9 million and 74.7 million lower
than the same periods in 2005 primarily as a result of the company&#146;s common
share repurchase program.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">45</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='45',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Segment
Details</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is
an analysis of the third quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus
third&#160; quarter and first nine months of
2005, respectively, reportable segment results.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The table below
presents each reportable segments&#146; external revenue as a percentage of total
external segment revenue excluding the Personal Computing business which was
divested on April 30, 2005:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="63%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:63.94%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.74%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Three&nbsp;Months&nbsp;Ended</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.74%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Nine&nbsp;Months&nbsp;Ended</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="63%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:63.94%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.74%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">September&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Business Transformation Outsourcing</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,376</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,141</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Business
  Services</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11,746</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11,926</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Services
revenue increased 2.7 percent (2 percent adjusted for currency) and 0.2 percent
(1 percent adjusted for currency) in the third quarter and first nine months of
2006, respectively, versus the same periods in 2005.&#160; The growth rate in the third quarter improved
sequentially in both Global Technology Services and Global Business Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Technology
Services&#160; (GTS) revenue increased 3.5
percent (2 percent adjusted for currency) in the third quarter and 1.1 percent
(2 percent adjusted for currency) in the first nine months versus the same
periods of 2005, respectively. In the third quarter, GTS longer-term signings
were down 14 percent year-to-year while shorter-term signings increased 7
percent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Strategic
Outsourcing revenue was up 5.7 percent as reported in the third quarter (4
percent adjusted for currency) and 1.8 percent (up 3 percent adjusted for
currency) in the first nine months versus the comparable prior year periods.
Strategic Outsourcing signings were down 29 percent year-to-year in the
quarter. For the third quarter, while total signings were down,&#160; revenue growth improved due to signings
growth in 2005 and a continued focus on increasing services into existing
accounts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Integrated
Technology Services (ITS) revenue decreased 1.6 percent (3 percent adjusted for
currency) and 4.4 percent (4 percent adjusted for currency) in the third
quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the same periods of 2005.&#160; Over the last few quarters the company has
been implementing changes to improve the ITS business, including streamlining
offerings and aligning skills to address higher growth and higher value
areas.&#160; While it has taken longer than
anticipated to show significant improvement, the third quarter demonstrated
progress.&#160; In the third quarter, signings
were up 7 percent year-to-year&#160; with
growth in Asia Pacific and Europe, the geographies where the transformational
changes were first implemented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Business
Transformation Outsourcing (BTO) revenue was up 4.9 percent as &#160;reported (4 percent adjusted for currency) in
the third quarter and 20.6 percent as reported (22 percent adjusted for
currency) in the first nine months versus the same periods of 2005.&#160; The rate of revenue growth in BTO continues
to be negatively impacted by a significant contract renegotiation which will
continue through the first quarter of 2007.&#160;
BTO signings, however, were up 162 percent year-to-year in the third
quarter, with signings across key offering areas including Human Resources,
Finance and Accounting, Procurement and Supply Chain.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">47</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='47',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The GTS segment
pre-tax profit margin for the third quarter was 9.6 percent, a decrease of&#160; 0.9 points year-to-year.&#160; The company is continuing to invest in sales,
delivery and business development skills across the entire set of offerings, as
well as investing in SO infrastructure and BTO capabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Business
Services (GBS) revenue increased 1.2 percent (1 percent adjusted for currency)
in the third quarter and decreased 1.5 percent (flat adjusted for currency) in
the&#160; first nine months of 2006,
respectively, versus the same periods in 2005. The rate of growth in the
quarter improved sequentially. For the quarter, shorter-term signings increased
11 percent, driven by growth in the Americas and Asia Pacific,&#160; and longer-term signings decreased 22
percent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company is
continuing to invest in high value-add Business Solutions. The company is
enhancing its Global Development Center capabilities in China and India to
leverage the recent Webify acquisition and to accelerate SOA within its
industry solutions.&#160; Increased
investments in business development resources are being made to drive pipeline
and revenue growth in the Application Management Services business. The company
is also continuing to invest in key industry skills and solution specialists in
selected countries.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The GBS segment
third-quarter 2006 pre-tax profit margin improved 2.6 points year-to-year to
9.4 percent. Over the past 18 months the company has been implementing a
transformation of its operations to improve profitability. This transformation
included the restructuring actions taken in 2005, the deployment of global
resource management tools and end-to-end optimization of sourcing models, as
well as increased focus on deal selectivity.&#160;
These actions have yielded consistent improvement in utilization, better
contract quality and increased profit margins.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.1%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="67%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:67.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">For&nbsp;the&nbsp;three&nbsp;months&nbsp;ended&nbsp;September&nbsp;30:</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.32%;">

  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">48</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='48',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Services
gross profit dollars continued to increase primarily due to the benefits from
productivity initiatives and cost efficiencies, including improved
utilization.&#160; Gross profit margins
improved in both the third quarter and first nine months across all Global
Services categories, except for BTO in the third quarter of 2006.<b>&#160; </b>GBS
margins for the first nine months of 2006, although improved overall when
compared to 2005, were negatively impacted by increased delivery costs in Japan
on a select number of contracts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Global Services Signings</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total signings for
Global Services&#160; were $10.5 billion for
the third quarter of 2006.&#160; Shorter-term
signings increased 9 percent versus the third quarter of 2005 and longer-term
signings were down 15 percent versus the third quarter of 2005.&#160; In the third quarter of 2006, the company
signed 12 deals larger than $100 million and the company&#146;s total Global
Services backlog was estimated at $109 billion, flat versus June 30, 2006 and
down $2 billion from&#160; December 31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Global Technology Services Signings</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12,372</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13,587</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">*
Longer-term contracts are generally 7 to 10 years in length and represent SO
and longer-term BTO contracts as well as GBS contracts with the U.S. Federal
government and its agencies and AMS for custom and legacy applications.&#160; Shorter-term are contracts generally 3 to 9
months in length and represent the remaining GBS portfolio of&#160; Consulting and Systems Integration, AMS
packaged applications and ITS contracts.&#160;
These amounts have been adjusted to exclude the&#160; impact of&#160;
year-to-year currency changes</font></i><b>.</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Services
signings are management&#146;s initial estimate of the value of a client&#146;s
commitment under a Global Services contract. Signings are used by management to
assess period performance of Global Services management. There are no
third-party standards or requirements governing the calculation of signings.
The calculation used by management is an approximation of constant currency,
and involves estimates and judgments to gauge the extent of a client&#146;s
commitment, including the type and duration of the agreement, and the presence
of termination charges or wind-down costs. For example, for longer-term
contracts that require significant up front investment by the company, the
portions of these contracts that are counted as a signing are those periods in
which there is a significant economic impact on the client if the commitment is
not achieved, usually through a termination charge or the client incurring
significant</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">49</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='49',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">wind-down costs as a
result of the termination. For shorter-term contracts that do not require
significant up front investments, a signing is usually equal to the full
contract value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Signings include
SO, BTO, ITS and GBS contracts. Contract extensions and increases in scope are
treated as signings only to the extent of the incremental new value.&#160; Maintenance is not included in signings as
maintenance contracts tend to be more steady-state, where revenues equal
renewals, and therefore, the company does not think they are as useful a
predictor of future performance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Backlog includes
SO, BTO, ITS, GBS, and Maintenance.&#160;
Backlog is intended to be a statement of overall work under contract and
therefore does include Maintenance. Backlog estimates are subject to change and
are affected by several factors, including terminations, changes in the scope
of contracts, periodic revalidations, adjustments for revenue not materialized
and currency assumptions used to approximate constant currency.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Contract
portfolios purchased in an acquisition are treated as positive backlog
adjustments provided those contracts meet the company&#146;s requirements for
initial signings. A new signing will be recognized if a new services agreement
is signed incidental or coincident to an acquisition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hardware</font></u></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Change</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">

  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">nm - not meaningful</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">50</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,876</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">nm</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">nm - not meaningful</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Systems and
Technology Group revenue increased 9.6 percent (8 percent adjusted for
currency) and 5.4 percent (6 percent adjusted for currency)&#160; in the third quarter and first nine months of
2006, respectively, versus the same periods in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System z revenue
increased 24.7 percent and 10.1 percent (22 percent and 10 percent adjusted for
currency) in the third quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the third
quarter and first nine months of 2005, respectively.&#160; MIPS (millions of instructions per second)
shipments increased 16 percent in the third quarter versus the third quarter of
2005 and reflects continued strong customer acceptance of both specialty
engines for Linux and Java workloads and traditional mainframe workloads.&#160; The company at the end of the third quarter
had an installed inventory that has surpassed 10 million MIPS.&#160; Systems z performance in the third quarter
also reflected good sales execution.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System i revenue
decreased 21.6 percent and 17.1 percent (23 percent and 17 percent adjusted for
currency) in the third quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the same
periods in 2005, respectively.&#160; The
company completed its transition to POWER5+ in the third quarter, however, the
current quarter compares to a strong third quarter of 2005 which had a 25
percent revenue growth.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System p revenue
increased 9.9 percent and declined 3.3 percent (up 8 percent and down 3 percent
adjusted for currency) in the third quarter and first nine months of 2006
versus the third quarter and first nine months of 2005.&#160; In the third quarter the company completed
its transition to POWER 5+ and expanded the implementation of POWER Quadcore
technology to all POWER-based entry level System p products.&#160; These transitions allow the company to
sustain the price/performance and virtualization leadership position that has
made the company the number one UNIX vendor worldwide.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">51</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='51',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System x revenue
increased 2.1 percent and increased 2.7 percent (1 percent and 3 percent
adjusted for currency) in the third quarter and first nine months of 2006
versus the third quarter and first nine months of 2005.&#160; System x server revenue increased 4.2 percent
and 4.6 percent in the third quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the
third quarter and first nine months of 2005.&#160;
System x blades growth remained strong with revenue growth of 24.0
percent and 34.7 percent over last year&#146;s levels in the third quarter and first
nine months of 2006.&#160; IBM BladeCenter
offers clients unique power and cooling capabilities and the flexibility to
efficiently handle various workloads.&#160; In
addition to the company&#146;s System x blades, the company offers POWER blades and
blades utilizing the Cell Broadband Engine.&#160;
Total blade growth, including System p, was 31 percent in the third
quarter and 39 percent for the nine months period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System Storage
revenue increased 11.8 percent and increased 4.9 percent (11 percent and
increased 5 percent adjusted for currency) in the third quarter and first nine
months of 2006 versus the comparable periods in 2005.&#160; Total disk revenue increased 13.9 percent and
6.0 percent, respectively, for the third quarter and first nine months of 2006
versus the same periods in 2005.&#160;
Midrange disk revenue increased 12.4 percent and 13.4 percent versus the
third quarter and first nine months of 2005 and enterprise disk revenue
increased 12.5&#160; percent versus the third
quarter of 2005 and declined 5.0 percent for the first nine months of 2006 when
compared to the first nine months of 2005.&#160;
The third-quarter enterprise disk revenue increase was primarily driven
by the&#160; DS8000 family of products, with
almost 30 percent growth, as the company introduced POWER5+ technology to this
product.&#160; Tape products revenue increased
8.0 percent and 2.7 percent, respectively, for the third quarter and first nine
months of 2006 versus the same periods of 2005.&#160;
The company had good market acceptance of its new tape security offering
with unique encryption capabilities in the third quarter of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Microelectronics
revenue increased 28.8 percent and 36.3 percent, respectively, for the third
quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the comparable periods of
2005.&#160; The increase in revenue was driven
by continued strong demand in the games processor business and networking
components.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retail Stores
Solutions revenue increased primarily due to clients replacing their older point
of sale hardware and growth in the company&#146;s self service/kiosk solutions.&#160; Printer Systems revenue decreased due
primarily to lower maintenance revenue as a result of a declining install base
and lower sales of hardware products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Personal Computing
Division revenue decreased as a result of the company divesting its Personal
Computing business to Lenovo on April 30, 2005.&#160;
The third quarter and first nine months of 2006 results do not have any
reported revenue versus 2005, which includes no revenue in the third&#160; quarter and four months of revenue for the
first nine months.&#160; (See Note 9 on page
19 for additional information).</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">52</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>

  <td width="69%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:69.02%;">

  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Yr.&nbsp;to&nbsp;Yr.</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5,331</font></p>

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34.5%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pts.</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="518" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="43" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="43" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="25" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increases in
gross profit dollars for the third quarter of 2006 versus 2005 was primarily due
to revenue growth, particularly in the high margin System z servers.&#160; The decrease in gross profit dollars for the
first nine months of 2006 versus 2005 was primarily due to the sale of the Personal
Computing business in the second quarter of 2005. This divestiture drove 5.3
points improvement in&#160; the first nine
months of 2006 gross profit margin. The Personal Computing business had a lower
gross profit margin than the other hardware products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Systems and
Technology Group gross profit margins declined for the third quarter and the
first nine months of 2006 (38.2 percent and 35.8 percent) versus the same
periods of 2005 (39.1 percent and 39.8 percent), respectively.&#160; The third quarter gross profit margin
improved sequentially versus the first and second quarter, but declined year-to-year.&#160; The decline in the third quarter gross profit
margin was driven by revenue mix towards the Microelectronics business, pricing
pressures in the mid-range and low-end servers, partially offset by strong
revenue growth and improved margins in System z mainframes and improved margins
in System Storage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Differences
between the hardware segment gross margin and profit amounts above and the amounts
reported on page 39 (and derived from page one) primarily relate to the impact
of certain hedging transactions&#160; (see
Anticipated Royalties and Cost Transactions on page 72 of the IBM 2005 Annual
Report) as well as the ongoing warranty costs associated with the divested Personal
Computing business. The recorded amounts for such impact are considered
unallocated corporate amounts for purposes of measuring segment management&#146;s
gross margin performance and therefore are not included in the segment results
above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">53</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='53',FILE='C:\fc\3042112598_D12364_1444073\19062-7-ge.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 02:11 2006' -->

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29.7</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">194</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:70.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">For&nbsp;the&nbsp;nine&nbsp;months&nbsp;ended&nbsp;September&nbsp;30:</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  Systems</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,771</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:70.78%;">

  Lifecycle Management</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">803</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">739</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:70.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">597</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">564</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt -3.6pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Software revenue
increased 8.5 percent (7 percent adjusted for currency) and 5.2&#160; percent (6 percent adjusting for currency) in
the third quarter and first nine months of 2006, respectively, versus the same
periods of 2005.&#160; This growth was driven
by the company&#146;s key branded middleware portfolio, as clients leverage the
company&#146;s end-to-end middleware capabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company has
been investing in its software business both internally and through targeted
acquisitions. Revenue performance during 2006 underscores that the company&#146;s
strategy is working.&#160; An increasing
number of customers have embraced the company&#146;s integrated</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">54</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='54',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">software portfolio.&#160; This improves the clients&#146; efficiency and is
reflected in a number of large transactions completed in the third quarter. The
company&#146;s investments are also carrying it more deeply into targeted markets.
For example, the investments in Systems Management, including the acquisition
of Micromuse, have enabled the company to offer unique capabilities to its
communications clients, and contributed to Tivoli&#146;s strong performance. In
addition, the company&#146;s advanced new technologies, such as Services Oriented
Architecture (SOA) and Information on Demand, are also being well received by
clients. These technologies form the underpinnings of more integrated
solutions, incorporating the company&#146;s software, services and hardware
capabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Key Branded
Middleware is made up of five key brands which provide an integrated suite for
the company&#146;s customers. All five brands had growth in the third quarter with
double-digit growth in WebSphere, Information Management and Tivoli.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The WebSphere
family of software revenue increased (29.7 percent and 24.1 percent) in the
third quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the third quarter and first
nine months of 2005, respectively.&#160;
WebSphere provides the foundation for web-enabled applications and is a
key product set in deploying a client&#146;s SOA.&#160;
In 2006, WebSphere technology has accelerated the emergence and
acceptance of SOA, contributing&#160; to
double-digit revenue growth in WebSphere each quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information
Management software revenue increased (11.8 percent and 8.2 percent) in the
third quarter and first nine months of 2006 versus the same periods in 2005,
respectively. The company&#146;s Information on Demand portfolio builds value around
the company&#146;s core database business.&#160;
These offerings grew over 50 percent year-to-year in the third quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Tivoli software
revenue increased (44.3 percent and 26.9 percent) in the third quarter and
first nine months of 2006 versus the same periods in 2005, respectively.&#160; The third quarter performance in Tivoli was
broad-based with greater than 35 percent growth in each of the three key Tivoli
segments: Systems Management, Security and Storage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lotus software
revenue increased (8.2 percent and 4.9 percent) in the third quarter and first
nine months of 2006 versus the same periods in 2005, respectively, benefiting
from continued momentum in its collaboration products and strong customer
loyalty.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rational software
revenue increased (2.5 percent and 0.9 percent) in the third quarter and first nine
months versus the same periods in 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue from Other
Middleware products declined (0.7 percent and 1.8 percent) in the third quarter
and first nine months of 2006 when compared to the same periods in 2005,&#160; espectively.&#160;
Other Middleware includes more mature products which provide a stable
flow of revenue and profit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Systems
software revenue declined (6.1 percent and 7.9 percent) in the third quarter
and first nine months of 2006 versus the same periods in 2005.&#160; The decline was due to improved price
performance in System z and volume declines in System i.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">55</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='55',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Product Lifecycle
Management (PLM) software revenue increased 1.0 percent in the third quarter
and increased 8.7 percent in the first nine months of 2006 versus the same
periods in 2005, respectively. PLM software helps companies improve their
product development processes and their ability to use product-related
information across their business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="70%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:70.76%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(Dollars&nbsp;in&nbsp;millions)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <td width="530" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="43" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="43" style="border:none;"></td>
