<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Software gross
profit dollars increased for the third quarter and first nine months of 2006
versus the same periods of 2005 driven primarily by&#160; revenue growth.&#160; Gross profit margins in both the third
quarter and first nine months were relatively flat when compared to the same
periods in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Overall, Software
revenue growth drove increased profit performance.&#160; The Software segment pre-tax margin of 26.2
percent improved 1.4 points versus the third quarter of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See pages 64 and
65 for a discussion of Global Financing&#146;s revenue and gross profit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Results
of Discontinued Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There was no losses
from Discontinued Operations in the third quarter and first nine months of
2006, respectively, versus no losses and $27 million in the third quarter and
first nine months of 2005.&#160; The 2005
charges were for additional costs associated with parts warranty as agreed upon
by the company and Hitachi Ltd., under the terms of the agreement for the sale
of the hard disk drive business to Hitachi Ltd. on December 31, 2002.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">56</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Financial Position</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dynamics</font></u></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The assets and
debt associated with the company&#146;s Global Financing business are a significant
part of </font>IBM&#146;s
financial position. Accordingly, although the financial position amounts
appearing on pages 3 and 4 are the company&#146;s consolidated amounts including
Global Financing, to the extent the Global Financing business is a major driver
of the Consolidated Financial Position, reference in the narrative section will
be made to a separate Global Financing section in this Management Discussion on
pages 64 to 71. The amounts appearing in the separate Global Financing section
are supplementary data presented to facilitate an understanding of the company&#146;s
Global Financing business.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Working Capital</font></u></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Current assets
decreased $4,993 million due to declines of: $2,786 million in Cash and cash
equivalents and Marketable securities due to pension funding, share repurchase,
dividend payments, tax payments, and capital investments (see Cash Flow
analysis on page 58), and $1,746 million ($2,481 million excluding the positive
currency translation effect of $734 million) in short-term receivables mainly
due to collection of seasonally high year-end balances.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Current liabilities
decreased $223 million due to declines of: $487 million in Accounts payable and
$586 million in Taxes payable&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;both resulting from declines in these
balances from typically higher year-end levels; and $355 million in
infrastructure reduction accruals primarily driven by workforce reduction
payments in 2006 associated with the restructuring activities initiated in the
second quarter of 2005.&#160; These declines
were partially offset by an increase of $1,339 million in short-term debt
primarily due to a reclass from long-term to short-term as the debt approaches
maturity.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">57</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='57',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash Flow</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s cash
flow from operating, investing and financing activities, as reflected in the
Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows on page 5, is summarized in the table below.
These amounts include the cash flows associated with the company&#146;s Global
Financing business.<i> </i>&#160;See pages 64 to 71.</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4,084</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1,801</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increase in
net cash provided by operating activities for the first nine months of 2006 as
compared to the first nine months of 2005 was primarily driven by lower pension
funding of approximately $453 million ($1,676 million funding of non-U.S. plans
in 2006 versus $2,129 million funding in 2005 [U.S. PPP of $1,700 million and
non-U.S. plans of $429 million] ), growth in net income and continued focus on
working capital and supply chain management.&#160;
This increase was partially offset by $1,780 million less cash provided
by Global Financing receivables due to growth in the third quarter and
increased tax payments of approximately $300 million year-to-date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increase in
net cash flows used in investing activities was attributable to net purchases
of marketable securities and other investments in 2006 of approximately $1.7
billion, compared to net proceeds of $0.7 billion in 2005.&#160; This increase was primarily due to increased
investment in short-term marketable securities, and the $0.7 billion of net
cash received in 2005 as a result of the divestiture of the Personal Computing
business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increase in
net cash flows used in financing activities in the first nine months of 2006
compared with the same period of 2005 was primarily driven by lower proceeds
from new debt of approximately $3.9 billion, which was attributable to a
decrease in new debt issuances and $0.3 billion increase in cash dividends
paid. This increase was partially offset by a decrease of $4.0 billion in net
payments to settle debt and short-term borrowings in 2006 versus 2005.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">58</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13,436</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15,425</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="71%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:71.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-current liabilities
  (excluding debt)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21,542</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22,073</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="531" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="82" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="82" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="2" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increase in
Non-current assets was primarily due to an increase of $2,579 million ($535
million due to the effects of currency) in Prepaid pension assets driven by the
funding of the U.K. pension fund and an $896 million ($199 million due to
effects of currency) increase in goodwill which was primarily driven by the
Micromuse acquisition in the first quarter of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term debt
decreased $1,988 million primarily due to a reclass to short-term debt as these
items approach maturity.&#160; The company
continually monitors interest rates and manages its short-term and long-term
debt portfolios accordingly.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-current
liabilities (excluding debt) decreased $531 million primarily due to a decrease
of $767 million in Retirement and nonpension postretirement obligations driven
by the funding of the U.K. pension fund, offset by a $236 million increase in
Other liabilities driven by the effects of currency. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s
funding requirements are continually monitored and strategies are executed to
manage the company&#146;s overall asset and liability profile. Additionally, the
company maintains sufficient flexibility to access global funding sources as
needed.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  </td>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Non-global
financing debt is the company&#146;s total external debt less the Global Financing
debt described in the Global Financing balance sheet on page 66.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-global
financing debt decreased $1,420 million and the debt-to-capitalization ratio of
2.3 percent was within the company&#146;s target range.&#160; Non-global financing debt decreased as the
company paid down debt, including debt raised in 2005 to facilitate the company&#146;s
repatriation actions under the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">59</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='59',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders&#146; Equity</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders&#146;
equity increased $1,149 million from December 31, 2005, primarily due to an
increase in the company&#146;s retained earnings driven by net income and a
reduction of approximately $1.4 billion in the minimum pension liability due to
amendments made in certain non-U.S. plans that resulted in remeasurements;
partially offset by the company&#146;s ongoing stock repurchase program ($6,634
million) and higher dividend payments of $297 million in the first nine months
of 2006 versus the first nine months of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Looking
Forward</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following key
drivers impacting IBM&#146;s business are described in more detail in the 2005 IBM
Annual Report on page 21.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Economic
environment and corporate spending budgets</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Internal
business transformation and global integration initiatives</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Innovation
initiatives</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Open standards</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Investing in
growth opportunities</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s
balanced portfolio of businesses - hardware, software and services - is
designed to deliver the company&#146;s longer-term financial objective of
double-digit earnings per share growth.&#160;
This portfolio generates a profit profile that is also relatively
balanced among the three major businesses.&#160;
The business mix will vary by quarter, based on skew and other
factors.&#160; The strength of the company&#146;s
business model is not in any single component - it is in the company&#146;s ability
to integrate across its portfolio on a global basis to create solutions for its
clients.&#160; In addition, a key element of
the company&#146;s business model is its ability to deliver its objective of
earnings per share growth through a combination of revenue growth, productivity
and the effective use of cash.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the third
quarter, the company&#146;s Global Services business increased its revenue growth
rate sequentially in both Global Technology Services and Global Business
Services.&#160; Shorter-term signings
increased while longer-term signings were down versus the prior year.&#160; Going forward, the company is focused on
converting its opportunity pipeline into longer-term signings growth.&#160; In addition, the company is continuing to
focus on the actions it has implemented to improve its services business - the
third quarter demonstrated progress in this area.&#160; The company has also made targeted
investments, both in GTS and GBS.&#160; These
investments are designed to drive revenue growth and continued productivity improvements
over time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Within its Systems
and Technology business, the company completed key product transitions in its
server and storage brands in the third quarter.&#160;
This contributed to improved performance led by System p and System Storage
as well as strong growth in System z and System x blades.&#160; The company will continue to focus on the
value that its leading technologies, such as POWER5+, can bring to developing
innovative solutions for clients.&#160; In
addition, while the company expects continued strong demand for its
Microelectronics business, the company also expects the revenue growth rate in
the fourth quarter will moderate after growing over 25 percent for four
consecutive quarters.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">60</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='60',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Within Software,
the company expects its Key Branded Middleware products to continue to benefit
from its internal development investments, targeted acquisition strategy and
continued market opportunity for the company&#146;s product offerings, including its
focus on key emerging trends such as Services Oriented Architecture and
Information on Demand.&#160; The company will
increase its software portfolio in the fourth quarter by beginning the
integration of key acquisitions such as MRO Software Inc., and FileNet
Corporation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The amount of IP
and custom development income has been declining in recent years and decreased
in the first nine months of 2006.&#160; The
overall declining trend may continue as the company does not expect IP and
custom development income to be a contributor to growth in earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
Retirement-related benefits expense increased in the first nine months of 2006,
as compared with the first nine months of&#160;
2005, by $177 million as discussed on pages 43 and 44.&#160; For the full year, the company estimates
pre-tax retirement-related plan expense to be approximately flat&#160; when compared to 2005.&#160; This is less then the previously estimated
range of a $100 - $200 million increase discussed on page 37 of the company&#146;s
2005 Annual Report.&#160; The change in
projected expense is due to reductions in the company&#146;s non-U.S. pension plans.&#160; Excluding effects of one-time charges
incurred in 2005 for pension curtailment ($267 million) and charges related to
the second quarter 2005 restructuring actions ($65 million), the expected
year-to-year impact on retirement-related plan expense is an increase of
approximately $300 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the normal
course of business, the company expects that its effective tax rate will
approximate 30 percent. The rate will change year-to-year based on nonrecurring
events (such as the third-quarter 2005 tax charge associated with the
repatriation of $9.5 billion under the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004) as
well as recurring factors including the geographic mix of income before taxes,
the timing and amount of foreign dividends, state and local taxes, and the interaction
of various global tax strategies.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2005, the
company&#146;s cash tax rate declined slightly to 16 percent from 17 percent in
2004.&#160; The company&#146;s cash tax rate
represents the amount of income taxes paid during the year over Income from
continuing operations before income taxes.&#160;
It is expected that the company&#146;s cash tax rate will increase in 2006 to
approximately 20 percent, primarily as a result of the utilization of its U.S.
Federal alternative minimum tax credits.&#160;
The company anticipates that its cash tax rate will approximate 22
percent in the near term.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Currency Rate
Fluctuations</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in the
relative values of non-U.S. currencies to the U.S. dollar affect the company&#146;s
results.&#160; At September 30, 2006, currency
changes resulted in assets and liabilities denominated in local currencies
being translated into more U.S. dollars than at year-end 2005. The company uses
a variety of financial hedging instruments to limit specific currency risks
related to financing transactions and other foreign currency-based
transactions. Further discussion of currency and hedging appears in the 2005
IBM Annual Report in note L, &#147;Derivatives and Hedging Transactions,&#148; on pages&nbsp;&nbsp; 71
to 74.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">61</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='61',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company earned
over 60 percent of its net income in currencies other than the U.S. dollar in
the first nine months of 2006.&#160; In
general, these currencies were weaker against the U.S. dollar during the first
nine months of 2006 compared to the same period of 2005, resulting in 2006
foreign currency earnings translated into fewer dollars than they would have in
the first nine months of 2005.&#160; The
company maintains hedging programs to limit the volatility of currency impacts
on its financial results.&#160; These hedging
programs limit the impact of currency changes on the company&#146;s financial
results but do not eliminate them.&#160; In
addition to the translation of earnings and the company&#146;s hedging programs, the
impact of currency may also affect the company&#146;s pricing and sourcing actions,
although the impact of these actions on net income is difficult to track and
quantify.&#160; For these reasons, the company
believes that extended periods of dollar weakness are positive for net income
and extended periods of dollar strength are negative, although the precise
impact is difficult to assess.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For non-U.S.
subsidiaries and branches that operate in U.S. dollars or whose economic
environment is highly inflationary, translation adjustments are reflected in
results of operations, as required by SFAS No.&nbsp;52, &#147;Foreign Currency
Translation.&#148; Generally, the company manages currency risk in these entities by
linking prices and contracts to U.S. dollars and by entering into foreign
currency hedge contracts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liquidity and Capital
Resources</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On pages 38 and 39
of the company&#146;s 2005 Annual Report, there is a discussion of the company&#146;s
liquidity including two tables that present five years of data.&#160; One table, on page 38, includes each of the
past five years of the company&#146;s Net cash from operating activities, Cash and
marketable securities, the size of the company&#146;s global credit facilities and
committed trade receivables securitization facility.&#160; For the nine months ended or as of, as
applicable, September 30, 2006, those amounts are $9.7 billion, $10.9 billion,
$10.0 billion and $0.0 billion, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July 28, 2006,
the company terminated its committed trade receivables securitization
facility.&#160; This facility was initially
established in July, 2004 and provided the company with securitization
capability up to $0.5 billion.&#160; The
facility was terminated as management determined that the company has
sufficient liquidity and alternative funding resources.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June 28, 2006,
the company entered into a new 5-year $10,000,000,000 Credit Agreement (the &#147;Credit
Agreement&#148;).&#160; The Credit Agreement
replaces the company&#146;s existing 5-year $10,000,000,000 Credit Agreement (the &#147;Existing
Credit Agreement&#148;) dated May 27, 2004.&#160;
The Existing Credit Agreement was not otherwise due to expire until May
27, 2009.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Credit
Agreement permits the company and its Subsidiary Borrowers to borrow up to $10
billion on a revolving basis.&#160; Borrowings
of the Subsidiary Borrowers will be unconditionally guaranteed by the
company.&#160; The company may also, upon the
agreement of either the then existing Lenders, or of additional banks not
currently party to the Credit agreement, increase the commitments under the
Credit Agreement up to an additional $2.0 billion. Subject to certain
conditions stated in the Credit Agreement, the company and Subsidiary Borrowers
may borrow, prepay and reborrow amounts under the Credit Agreement at any time
during the term of the Credit Agreement. Funds borrowed may be used for the
general corporate</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">62</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='62',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:5.0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">purposes of the company and its subsidiaries,
including the support of outstanding commercial paper issuances of the company
and its subsidiaries.&#160; The Credit
Agreement terminates on June 28, 2011.&#160;
Interest rates on borrowings under the Credit Agreement will be based on
prevailing market interest rates, as further described in the Credit
Agreement.&#160; The Credit Agreement contains
customary representations and warranties, covenants, events of default, and
indemnification provisions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The major rating
agencies&#146; ratings on the company&#146;s debt securities at September 30, 2006 appear
in the table below and remain unchanged from December 31, 2005.&#160; The company has no contractual arrangements
that, in the event of a change in credit rating, would result in a material
adverse effect on its financial position or liquidity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:19.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The second table,
appearing on page 39 of the 2005 IBM Annual Report, presents the way in which
management reviews its cash flows for each of the past five years and is
accompanied by a description of the way cash flow is managed, measured and
reviewed.&#160; While the company prepares its
Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows in accordance with SFAS No. 95, &#147;Statement
of Cash Flows,&#148; on page 5 of this Form 10-Q and discusses causes and events
underlying sources and uses of cash in that format on page 58 of this Form
10-Q, the following is the management view of cash flows for the first nine
months of 2006 and 2005 prepared in a manner consistent with the table on page
39 of the 2005 IBM Annual Report:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="81%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:81.6%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt -3.6pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">63</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='63',FILE='C:\fc\30484030325_D11240_1444876\19062-7-gg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 31 08:40 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 8 on
page 19 of this Form 10-Q, the company will expend between $3.7 - $4.2 billion
on strategic acquisitions in the fourth quarter of 2006.&#160; Given the company&#146;s strong cash balance and
seasonally strong cash from operations in the fourth quarter, these investments
will not materially impact the company&#146;s liquidity position.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Events that could
temporarily change the historical cash flow dynamics discussed above include
significant changes in operating results, material changes in geographic
sources of cash, unexpected adverse impacts from litigation or future pension
funding requirements during periods of severe and prolonged downturns in the
capital markets. Whether any litigation has such an adverse impact will depend
on a number of variables, which are more completely described in Note 12 on
pages 21 to 25 of this Form 10-Q. With respect to pension funding, the company
is not quantifying any impact from pension funding because it is not possible
to predict future movements in the capital markets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Actual return on the PPP
plan assets for the first nine months of 2006 was 9.35 percent.&#160; If the full year actual return on plan assets
for the PPP was less than 2.3 percent, the PPP&#146;s accumulated benefit obligation
would be greater than its plan assets (assuming no other assumption
changes).&#160; As discussed on pages 87 of
IBM&#146;s 2005 Annual Report, such a situation may result in a voluntary
contribution of cash or stock to the PPP.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Global
Financing</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing is a
business segment within </font>IBM
that is measured as if it were a standalone entity. Accordingly, the
information presented in this section is consistent with this separate company
view.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Results
of Operations</font></u></i></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="47%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:47.26%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:23.08%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Three&nbsp;Months&nbsp;Ended<br>
  September&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,544</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>See
page 71 for the details of the After-tax income and the Return on equity
calculation.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing revenue
increased 4.0 percent in the third quarter of 2006 versus the same period in
2005.&#160; External revenue decreased 2.1
percent (3.7 percent adjusted for currency) driven by external used equipment
sales of $137 million in 2006 versus $170 million in 2005, partially offset by
increased financing revenue of $450 million in 2006 versus $428 million in</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">64</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='64',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005.&#160; Internal revenue increased 16.7 percent
driven by internal used equipment sales of $187 million versus $162 million in
the third quarter of 2005, an increase of 15.3 percent due primarily to higher
sales to the Hardware segment, and financing revenue of $150 million in 2006
versus $127 million in 2005 due primarily to an increase in the average internal
asset balance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing revenue
decreased 1.0 percent in the first nine months of 2006 versus the same period
in 2005.&#160; External revenue decreased 3.0
percent (2.6 percent adjusted for currency) driven primarily by external used
equipment sales of $439 million in 2006 versus $499 million in 2005, partially
offset by improved financing revenue of $1,305 million in 2006 versus $1,298
million in 2005, an increase of 0.5 percent.&#160;
Internal revenue increased 2.6 percent driven by financing revenue of $434
million in the first nine months of 2006 versus $415 million in the same period
in 2005, an increase of 4.7 percent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing gross
profit dollars decreased $46 million or 8.7 percent for the third quarter and
decreased $39&nbsp;million or 2.5&nbsp;percent in the first nine months of 2006
when compared to the same periods last year.&#160;
For the third quarter of 2006, the decrease in gross profit dollars was
primarily driven by higher borrowing costs and lower equipment sales gross
profit, partially offset by the increase in financing revenue discussed
above.&#160; The decrease in gross profit
margin was driven by lower financing margins due to higher borrowing costs and
a decrease in equipment sales margins.&#160;
For the first nine months of 2006, the decrease in gross profit dollars
was driven by higher borrowing costs, partially offset by higher equipment
sales gross profit of $398&nbsp;million in 2006 versus $345&nbsp;million in
2005, an increase of 15.4&nbsp;percent, and the increase in financing revenue
discussed above.&#160; The decrease in gross
profit margin is driven by lower financing margins due to higher borrowing
costs, partially offset by an improvement in equipment sales margins.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing pre-tax
income decreased 7.9 percent and 2.3 percent, respectively, for the third
quarter and first nine months of 2006, when compared to the same periods last
year.&#160; The decrease in the third quarter
was driven by the decrease in gross profit of $46 million discussed above.&#160; The decrease in the first nine months of 2006
is primarily due to the decrease in gross profit of $39 million also discussed
above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The decrease in
return-on-equity in the third quarter of 2006 versus the third quarter of 2005,
and for the first nine months of 2006 compared to the first nine months of 2005
was primarily due to lower earnings.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">65</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='65',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="73" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:55.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31,165</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts eliminated
for purposes of IBM&#146;s consolidated results and therefore do not appear on pages
3 and 4.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>These assets, along
with all other financing assets in this table, are leveraged using Global
Financing debt.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Global
Financing debt includes debt of the company and of the Global Financing units
that support the Global Financing business.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sources and Uses
of Funds</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The primary use of funds
in Global Financing is to originate client and commercial financing assets.
Client financing assets for end users consist primarily of </font>IBM hardware, software and services,
but also include non-IBM
equipment, software and services to meet IBM
clients&#146; total solutions requirements. Client financing assets are primarily
sales-type, direct financing and operating leases for equipment as well as
loans for hardware, software and services with terms generally for two to seven
years. Global Financing&#146;s client loans are primarily for software and services
and are unsecured.&#160; These loans are
subjected to additional credit analysis in order to mitigate the associated
risk.&#160; Client financing also includes
internal activity as described on page 43 of the 2005 IBM Annual Report.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commercial financing
originations arise primarily from inventory and accounts receivable financing
for dealers and remarketers of </font>IBM and non-IBM
products. Payment terms for inventory financing generally range from 30 to 90
days. Payment terms for accounts receivable financing generally range from 30
to 90 days.</p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">66</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='66',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Originations</font></p>

external and internal financing originations.</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27,550</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total new originations
exceeded cash collections of client and commercial financing assets in the
third quarter of 2006, which resulted in a net increase in financing assets of
$306 million in this period versus June 30, 2006. The increase in originations
was mainly due to improving volumes in client financing.&#160; Cash collections of both customer and
commercial financing assets exceeded new financing originations in the first
nine months of 2006, which resulted in a net decline in financing assets from December
31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash generated by Global
Financing was primarily deployed to pay the intercompany payables and dividends
to </font>IBM.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financing Assets
by Sector</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
presents the percentage of external financing assets by industry sector.</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="361" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:270.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="361" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:270.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Business
Partners financing assets represent a portion of commercial financing inventory
and accounts receivable financing for terms generally less than 90 days.</p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">67</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='67',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financing Receivables and
Allowances</font></p>

presents financing receivables, excluding residual values, and the allowance
for doubtful accounts.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Roll-Forward of Financing
Receivables Allowance for Doubtful Accounts</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="50%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:50.58%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(Dollars&nbsp;in&nbsp;millions)<br>
  Dec.&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.88%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Allowance&nbsp;<br>
  Used*</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  (Reductions)<br>
  Bad&nbsp;Debt<br>
  Expense</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Other</font></b>**</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  2006</font></b></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">379</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="378" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="67" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="2" style="border:none;"></td>
