<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Represents
reserved receivables, net of recoveries, that were disposed of during the
period.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Primarily
represents currency translation adjustments.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The percentage of
financing receivables reserved decreased from 2.2 percent at December 31, 2005
to 1.8 percent at September 30, 2006 due to the disposition of previously
reserved receivables combined with lower requirements for additional
reserves.&#160; Unallocated reserves decreased
29 percent from $84 million at December 31, 2005 to $60 million at September
30, 2006.&#160; The decrease in unallocated
reserves is due to improved economic conditions and improved credit quality of
the portfolio, as well as the decline in gross financing receivables.&#160; Specific reserves decreased 24 percent from
$421 million to $319 million in 2006.&#160;
The decrease in specific reserves was due to the disposition of reserved
receivables during the period combined with lower requirements for additional
specific reserves.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing&#146;s bad
debt expense was a reduction of $27 million for the nine months ended September
30, 2006, compared with a reduction of $48 million for the nine months ended
September 30, 2005.&#160; The continued
reduction in bad debt expense was primarily attributed to the overall decline
in the financing asset portfolio, as well as the improvement in economic
conditions and the improved credit quality of the portfolio in the first nine
months of 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">68</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='68',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual Value</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual value is a risk
unique to the financing business and management of this risk is dependent upon
the ability to accurately project future equipment values at lease
inception.&#160; Global Financing has insight
into product plans and cycles for the IBM products under lease.&#160; Based upon this product information, Global
Financing continually monitors projections of future equipment values and
compares them to the residual values reflected in the portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing
optimizes the recovery of residual values by selling assets sourced from end of
lease, leasing used equipment to new clients, or extending lease arrangements
with current clients</font>. &#160;Sales of equipment, which are primarily
sourced from equipment returned at end of lease, represented 35.0 percent and
37.5 percent of Global Financing&#146;s revenue in the third quarter and first nine
months, respectively, of 2006 and 37.4 percent and 39.1 percent in the third
quarter and first nine months, respectively, of 2005.&#160; The decrease in the third quarter of 2006 was
driven by the improvement in financing revenue and the decrease for the first
nine months of 2006 was driven by a decline in external used equipment
sales.&#160; The gross margins on these sales
were 32.6 percent and 40.8 percent in the third quarter of 2006 and 2005,
respectively, and the gross margins were 38.1 percent and 31.4 percent for the
first nine months of 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; The decrease in gross margin in the third
quarter of 2006 from the third quarter of 2005 was primarily due to a lower
margin on internal equipment sales.&#160; The
increase in gross margin in the first nine months of 2006 from the first nine
months of 2005 was largely due to prior year early terminations of internal
leases and the subsequent sale of equipment to Global Services, which carried a
low gross profit margin.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
presents the recorded amount of unguaranteed residual value for sales-type and
operating leases at December 31, 2005 and September 30, 2006 for consolidated
IBM.&#160; In addition, the table presents the
residual value as a percentage of the original amount financed and a run out of
the unguaranteed residual value over the remaining lives of these leases as of
September 30, 2006.&#160; In addition to the
unguaranteed residual value below, on a limited basis, Global Financing will
obtain guarantees of the future value of the equipment scheduled to be returned
at end of lease. These third-party guarantees are included in lease payments as
provided for by accounting standards in the determination of lease
classifications for the covered equipment and provide protection against risk
of loss arising from declines in equipment values for these assets. The
residual value guarantee increases the minimum lease payments that are utilized
in determining the classification of a lease as a sales-type lease or operating
lease.&#160; The aggregate asset values
associated with the guarantees were $204 million and $110 million for the
financing transactions originated during the quarters ended September 30, 2006
and September 30, 2005, respectively, and $447 million and $351 million for the
nine months ended September 30, 2006 and September 30, 2005, respectively.&#160; The associated aggregate guaranteed future
values at the scheduled end of lease were $10 million and $4 million for the
financing transactions originated during the quarters ended September 30, 2006
and September 30, 2005, respectively, and $19 million and $13 million for the
financing transactions originated during the nine months ended September 30,
2006 and September 30, 2005, respectively.&#160;
The cost of guarantees was $1.4 million for the quarter ended September
30, 2006 and $2.4 million for the quarter ended September 30, 2005, and $3.3
million and $4.9 million for each of the nine months ended September 30, 2006
and September 30, 2005, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">69</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='69',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual Value</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.28%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.12%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.24%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.9x</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.7x</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing funds its
operations primarily through borrowings using a debt-to-equity ratio target of
approximately 7 to 1.&#160; The debt is used
to fund Global Financing assets. The debt is composed of intercompany loans and
external debt. The terms of the intercompany loans are set by the company to
substantially match the term and currency underlying the receivable. The
intercompany loans are based on arm&#146;s-length pricing. Both assets and debt are
presented in the Global Financing balance sheet on page 66.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s Global
Financing business provides funding predominantly for the company&#146;s external
clients but also provides intercompany financing for the company
(internal).&#160; As previously stated</font>, the company manages and measures Global Financing as if it were a
standalone entity and accordingly, interest expense relating to debt supporting
Global Financing&#146;s external client and internal business is included in the &#147;Global
Financing Results of Operations&#148; on page 64 and in Segment Information on pages
81 through 84.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the company&#146;s
Consolidated Statement of Earnings on page one, however, the interest expense
supporting Global Financing&#146;s internal financing to the company is reclassified
from Cost of Financing to Interest Expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liquidity and Capital
Resources</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing is a
segment of the company and as such is supported by the company&#146;s liquidity
position and access to capital markets. Cash generated from operations was
deployed to reduce debt and pay dividends to the company in order to maintain
an appropriate debt to equity ratio.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">70</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='70',FILE='C:\fc\30319258352_D12364_1443057\19062-7-gi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Oct 30 19:03 2006' -->

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.84%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">924</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Calculated
based upon an estimated tax rate principally based on Global Financing&#146;s
geographic mix of earnings as IBM&#146;s
provision for income taxes is determined on a consolidated basis.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Average
of the ending equity for Global Financing for the last 2 quarters and 4
quarters, for the three months ended September 30 and for the nine months ended
September 30, respectively</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Looking Forward</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Given Global Financing&#146;s
mission of supporting IBM&#146;s hardware, software, and services businesses,
originations for both client and commercial finance businesses will be
dependent upon the overall demand for IT hardware, software, and services, as
well as client participation rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the
company divesting its Personal Computing business to Lenovo in the second
quarter of 2005, Global Financing will support Lenovo&#146;s PC business through an
exclusive, five year agreement covering all Global Financing lines of business
effective May 1, 2005.&#160; These financings
with Lenovo are external revenue to Global Financing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest rates and the
overall economy (including currency fluctuations) will have an effect on both
revenue and gross profit. The company&#146;s interest rate risk management policy,
however, combined with the Global Financing funding strategy should mitigate
gross margin erosion due to changes in interest rates.&#160; The company&#146;s policy of matching asset and
liability positions in foreign currencies will limit the impacts of currency
fluctuations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The economy could impact
the credit quality of the Global Financing receivable portfolio and therefore the
level of provision for bad debt. Global Financing will continue to apply
rigorous credit policies in both the origination of new business and the
evaluation of the existing portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed above,
Global Financing has historically been able to manage residual value risk
through both insight into the product cycles as well as through its remarketing
business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing has
policies in place to manage each of the key risks involved in financing. These
policies, combined with product and client knowledge, should allow for the
prudent management of the business going forward, even during periods of
economic uncertainty.</font></p>


 <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;">71</p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward
Looking and Cautionary Statements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except for the historical
information and discussions contained herein, statements contained in this Form
10-Q may constitute &#147;forward looking statements&#148; within the meaning of the
Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These statements involve a
number of risks, uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual
results to differ materially, including the company&#146;s failure to continue to
develop and market new and innovative products and services and to keep pace
with technological change; competitive pressures; failure to obtain or protect
intellectual property rights; quarterly fluctuations in revenues and volatility
of stock prices; the company&#146;s ability to attract and retain key personnel;
adverse affects from tax matters; currency fluctuations and customer financing
risks; customer credit risk on trade receivables; the company&#146;s failure to
maintain the adequacy of its internal controls; the company&#146;s use of certain
estimates and assumptions; dependence on certain suppliers; changes in the
financial or business condition of the company&#146;s distributors or resellers; the
company&#146;s ability to successfully manage acquisitions and alliances; failure to
have sufficient insurance; legal, political, health and economic conditions;
risk factors related to IBM securities; and other risks, uncertainties and
factors discussed elsewhere in this Form 10-Q, in the company&#146;s Form 10-K and
in the company&#146;s other filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission or
in materials incorporated therein by reference.&#160;
The company assumes no obligation to update or revise any
forward-looking statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:5.0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM</font>
4. Controls and Procedures</font></b><a name="Item4_ControlsAndProcedures_131604"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s management
evaluated, with the participation of the Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer, the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls and
procedures as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based on that
evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer have
concluded that the company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures were effective
as of the end of the period covered by this report.&#160; There has been no change in the company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the quarter
covered by this report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Part </font></b>II - Other Information<a name="PartIiOtherInformation_050424"></a></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM 1.&#160; Legal Proceedings<a name="Item1_LegalProceedings_050425"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Refer to Note 12 on pages 21 to 25 of this Form 10-Q.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM 2.&#160; Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities,&#160; Use of Proceeds and Issuer Repurchases of
Equity Securities<a name="Item2_UnregisteredSalesOfEquitySe_050434"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The following table provides information relating to
the company&#146;s repurchase of common stock for the third quarter of 2006.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="32%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.68%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Period</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Total&nbsp;Number<br>
  of&nbsp;Shares<br>
  Purchased</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.36%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Average<br>
  Price&nbsp;Paid<br>
  per&nbsp;Share</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
April&#160; 25, 2006, the IBM Board of
Directors authorized up to $4.0 billion in funds for use in the company&#146;s
common stock repurchase program.&#160; IBM has
announced that under its repurchase program, it will repurchase shares on the
open market or in private transactions from time to time, depending on market
conditions.&#160; The repurchase program does
not have an expiration date.&#160; This table
does not include shares tendered to satisfy the exercise price in connection
with cashless exercises of employee stock options or shares tendered to satisfy
tax witholding obligations in connection with employee equity awards.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font face="Times New Roman">73</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Statement
  re: computation of ratios.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric ideograph-other;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.96%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  by CEO pursuant to Rule 13A-14(a) or 15D-14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act

  2002.</font></p>

on its behalf by the undersigned thereunto duly authorized.</font></p>
